The moment Danny received the message about the murder of Itzik, his only son, his life would never again be the same. Ten years of legal proceedings and new disclosures made during that time have slowly crumbled his faith in gaining justice. Along with the pain of his loss, he realizes that only he can find the truth of what happened that night. His journey in search of the truth reveals his complex identity for the first time: a spy who worked for the security services, an Arab who converted and became a practicing Jew, a man who felt pride, respect and sympathy for a country that has absurdly and horrifyingly betrayed him.  | Starring:

Based on the user's preference cues, I would recommend watching "We the Living" (1936).

The movie is a classic example of Ayn Rand's philosophy of Objectivism. The story follows three people who are struggling to survive in a brutal and unforgiving world.

Despite their struggles, these three individuals are determined to live as long and as well as possible.

Their determination and courage serve as an inspiration to us all, reminding us that no matter how difficult our circumstances may be, we must never give up hope.
